subject: p13352405
History: -year-old male patient with right-sided empyema, now status post three weeks of antibiotic treatment. Antibiotics now discontinued. Chest drain still in place. Evaluate for interval change.
Findings: PA and lateral chest views were obtained with patient in upright position. Comparison is performed with the next preceding similar study of. Heart size and mediastinal structures unchanged. On the right base, the previously described two pleural chest tubes remain in unaltered position. The degree of pleural densities blunting the lateral and posterior pleural sinus has regressed mildly. No new pulmonary abnormalities are present. No pneumothorax has developed. Left-sided hemithorax is unremarkable as before.
Impression: Mild regression of pleural densities right base in a patient with known empyema, still with chest two draining and tubes. No pneumothorax.
